text: Gian Carlo Menotti (, ; July 7, 1911 â€“ February 1, 2007) was an Italian- American composer and librettist. Although he often referred to himself as an American composer, he kept his Italian citizenship. He is well-known for his 1951 one-act opera, Amahl and the Night Visitors. It was commissioned by NBC for broadcast on television. Menotti wrote the music and the words.
